cc.alcina.framework.gwt.client.gwittir.widget
Class BoundTableExt

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
          com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Composite
              com.totsp.gwittir.client.ui.AbstractBoundWidget
                  com.totsp.gwittir.client.ui.table.AbstractTableWidget
                      cc.alcina.framework.gwt.client.gwittir.widget.BoundTableExt
All Implemented Interfaces:
HasBinding, com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.HasAttachHandlers, com.google.gwt.event.shared.HasHandlers, com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IsWidget, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.SourcesChangeEvents, com.totsp.gwittir.client.beans.SourcesPropertyChangeEvents, com.totsp.gwittir.client.keyboard.KeyBoundWidget, com.totsp.gwittir.client.ui.BoundWidget, com.totsp.gwittir.client.ui.table.HasChunks
Direct Known Subclasses:
FastROBoundTable
public class BoundTableExt
extends com.totsp.gwittir.client.ui.table.AbstractTableWidget
implements com.totsp.gwittir.client.ui.table.HasChunks, HasBinding

This is an option-rich table for use with objects implementing the SourcesPropertyChangeEvents interfaces.

Author:
Robert "kebernet" Cooper, Nick Reddel

Changes from gwittir.BoundTable

  • changed to protected: allRowsHandle, columns, masks, rowHandles, shiftDown, table, widgetCache , addRow(),
  • add: HANDLES_AS_CHECKBOXES, searchingMessage, noContentMessage, sortedColumn
  • method changes:
    • ordering in init() {works better with the logic, i think}
    • init(int) - support for handlesAsCheckboxes
    • renderAll() - support for searchingmessage, nocontentmessage, labels as HTML (see GridForm).
      Also show hide navrow if <=1 chunk, and render with display=none until the end (keep browser from reflowing unnecessarily)
    • first(), next(), previous(), last() - ignore if this.inChunk == true (otherwise we get errors on setchunk when people press things twice)
    • Visual hints (up/down arrows) to indicate column sort status
See Also:
SourcesPropertyChangeEvents

Field Detail

NONE_MASK

public static final int NONE_MASK
A placholder for no mask options (0)

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SCROLL_MASK

public static final int SCROLL_MASK
Renderer the table inside a scroll panel.

If the table has a DataProvider, it will use the "Google Reader" get-next-chunk-on-max-scroll operation.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HEADER_MASK

public static final int HEADER_MASK
Renderers a heading row on the table using the labels on the Column objects.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SPACER_ROW_MASK

public static final int SPACER_ROW_MASK
Tells the table to render a spacing row in between bound rows.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

NO_NAV_ROW_MASK

public static final int NO_NAV_ROW_MASK
If this table has a DataProvider AND it is not scrolling, this supresses the first, previous, next and last buttons at the bottom of the table.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SORT_MASK

public static final int SORT_MASK
Enables sorting on the table when a header row is clicked. If this table has a DataProvider, it must be a SortableDataProvider for this to work.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INSERT_WIDGET_MASK

public static final int INSERT_WIDGET_MASK
Enables the click in widget insertion. Note: This will use the default widget type for the model object from the BoundWidgetTypeFactory

See Also:
BoundWidgetTypeFactory, Constant Field Values

ROW_HANDLE_MASK

public static final int ROW_HANDLE_MASK
Determines whether buttons for row handles/selection should be present.

setWidth in class com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject

sortColumn

public void sortColumn(int index)
Sorts the table based on the value of the property in the specified column index. If using a SortableDataProvider, this will throw a runtime exception if the column denoted by the index is not a supported sortable column.

Parameters:
index - index of the column to sort the table on.
